gcci.text: At an average H100 price of $3.15/hr, supply is easing but high-bandwidth memory and advanced packaging remain chokepoints, keeping capex elevated and delivery timelines tight.

gtpi.text: An average input token price of $1.25/1M signals a race to the bottom in API pricing, favoring efficient models and compressing margins for providers that cannot deliver superior throughput or accuracy.

gagl.text: AI’s 120 TWh annual load is materially raising data center electricity demand, intensifying grid strain and accelerating interest in firm, low‑carbon power sources like nuclear to stabilize operations.

aipi.text: Hardware normalization, aggressive token price competition, and rising energy loads together point to rapid scale with mixed sustainability, implying a maturing market with bubble risks if firm power and capital discipline lag.
